Target Pajak Tak Tercapai, Sri Mulyani: Karena Gejolak Ekonomi
02 Nov 2019, 11:16 by Caesar Akbar, Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati membantah bahwa target penerimaan pajak terlalu tinggi. Sehingga angka tersebut kerap meleset untuk dicapai pemerintah. Ia mengatakan target itu sudah diambil dengan basis perhitungan dan diskusi dengan Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat.
Hanya saja, kondisi ekonomi belakangan memang berubah secara dinamis. "Kondisi ekonomi kan bisa saja berubah seperti yang terjadi tahun 2019 ini dikarenakan akselerasi dari perlambatan global mempengaruhi ekonomi dalam negeri," ujar Sri Mulyani di Kantor Kementerian Keuangan, Jakarta, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Dengan kondisi yang tidak pasti itu, maka asumsi harga komoditas hingga minyak pun berubah secara dinamis. Sehingga, pemerintah pun dalam memperkirakan komponen-komponen pembentuk Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Negara pun selalu akan dihadapkan pada kondisi yang tidak pasti.
Di sisi lain, Sri Mulyani menggarisbawahi bahwa berdasarkan peraturan perundang-undangan, berbagai perubahan kemungkinan itu sudah diwadahi. "Yang paling penting tentu adalah landasan hukum dan penggunaan APBN sendiri untuk tetap menjaga ekonomi namun tetap suistainable. Itu yang paling penting," tutur dia.
Karena itu, Sri Mulyani mengayakan bahwa dari sisi angka, terutama sisi penerimaan itu hampir tidak mungkin akurat. Sebab, perekonomian terus bergerak. "Namun kita juga akan terus mencoba mendekati apa yang sudah ditargetkan."
Pada 17 September lalu, Sri Mulyani mengungkapkan keyakinannya bahwa target penerimaan pajak 2019 akan tercapai. Meskipun, kata dia, saat ini ekonomi Indonesia dalam tekanan yang cukup berat. "Target penerimaan pajak 2019 itu berat, tapi bukan berarti tidak bisa kita capai," kata dia saat melantik pejabat eselon III Kementerian Keuangan, Jakarta, Selasa, 17 September 2019.
Pemerintah sebelumnya, menargetkan penerimaan pajak dalam APBN 2019 sebesar Rp 1.577 triliun. Sedangkan penerimaan pajak pada semester I sebesar Rp 603,34 triliun. Angka itu mencapai 38,25 persen dari target itu.
Di sisi lain, Sri Mulyani memprediksi defisit Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Negara tahun ini akan naik menuju angka 2-2,2 persen dari Produk Domestik Bruto dari sebelumnya 1,86 persen. "Jadi kami akan tetap menjaga," ujar dia.
Sebelumnya, risiko shortfall penerimaan pajak diproyeksikan terus berlanjut karena sampai 7 Oktober 2019 realisasi penerimaan pajak hanya Rp 912 triliun atau minus 0,31 persen. Dengan tren penerimaan yang minus 0,32 persen, realisasi penerimaan pajak tahun ini kemungkinan hanya akan berada pada angka 85 persen - 87 persen atau Rp 1.340,8 triliun - Rp 1.372,4 triliun dari target penerimaan sebesar Rp 1.577,5 triliun.
Sebelumnya, Ketua Bidang Perpajakan Asosiasi Pengusaha Indonesia Siddhi Widyaprathama mengomentari persoalan shortfall yang selama ini kerap terjadi. Siddhi menyarankan Direktorat Jenderal Pajak melakukan profiling. Sehingga, dari langkah tersebut dapat dilihat sektor usaha yang belum tercakup dan kepatuhannya rendah serta bagaimana pendekatannya.
Di samping itu, ia pun mengusulkan agar target penerimaan pajak dibuat berdasarkan angka yang sudah dicapai. "Bukan target tahun lalu dinaikkan lagi," ujar Siddhi.

Tax Target Not Achieved, Sri Mulyani: Because of Economic Turmoil
02 Nov 2019, 11:16 by Caesar Akbar, Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati has denied that the tax revenue target is too high. So the figure is often missed by the government. He said the target had been taken on the basis of calculations and discussions with the House of Representatives.
However, recent economic conditions have changed dynamically. "Economic conditions could change as happened in 2019 due to the acceleration of the global slowdown affecting the domestic economy," Sri Mulyani said at the Ministry of Finance Office, Jakarta, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
With these uncertain conditions, the assumption of commodity prices to oil changes dynamically. Thus, the government also estimates that the components forming the State Revenue and Expenditure Budget will always be faced with uncertain conditions.
On the other hand, Sri Mulyani underlined that based on statutory regulations, various possible changes have been contained. "The most important thing is of course the legal basis and the use of the state budget itself to maintain the economy while remaining sufainable. That is the most important," he said.
Therefore, Sri Mulyani envisaged that in terms of numbers, especially in terms of revenue it was almost impossible to be accurate. Because, the economy continues to move. "But we will also continue to try to approach what has been targeted."
On September 17, Sri Mulyani expressed her belief that the 2019 tax revenue target would be achieved. Although, he said, the Indonesian economy is currently under considerable pressure. "The 2019 tax revenue target is heavy, but that does not mean we cannot achieve it," he said while inaugurating echelon III officials at the Ministry of Finance, Jakarta, Tuesday, September 17, 2019.
Previously, the government targeted tax revenues in the 2019 APBN to be Rp. 1,577 trillion. While tax revenue in the first semester amounted to Rp 603.34 trillion. That number reached 38.25 percent of the target.
On the other hand, Sri Mulyani predicts that this year's State Budget deficit will rise to 2-2.2 percent of Gross Domestic Product from 1.86 percent previously. "So we will keep guarding," he said.
Previously, the risk of shortfall tax revenue was projected to continue because until October 7 2019 the realization of tax revenue was only Rp 912 trillion or minus 0.31 percent. With a revenue trend of minus 0.32 percent, the realization of tax revenue this year is likely to only be 85 percent - 87 percent or Rp 1,340.8 trillion - Rp 1,372.4 trillion from the revenue target of Rp 1,577.5 trillion.
Previously, the Chairperson of the Taxation Sector of the Indonesian Employers' Association, Siddhi Widyaprathama, commented on the problem of shortfalls that often occur. Siddhi suggested that the Directorate General of Taxation conduct profiling. So, from this step, it can be seen that business sectors are not yet covered and compliance is low and how to approach them.
In addition, he also suggested that the tax revenue target be made based on the figures that had been achieved. "It's not a target to be raised again last year," Siddhi said.
